result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald D. Halverson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay any restitution requested during the term of probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
May apply for expungement at age 21 if he successfully completes probation.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Write a letter of apology to the victim, to be pre-approved by his agent.
Restitution order signed 11-16-2015.  Must pay restitution during term of probation.  Restitution is to be paid directly to Black River Memorial Hospital on behalf of the victim.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  State moves to amend count 1.  To Class A misd. Battery.  Defendant plead no contest to amended Count 1.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Victim notification complied with.  Court advised the amended charge and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  Plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements reviewed with defendant.  Defendant understood.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation with conditions.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis.   Court found the defendant made his plea and waived his rights freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Find guilty as plead to.  State:  1 year probation,   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   LOA.  s/m employment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  May apply for expungment at age 21 if he successfully completes probation.  Attorney Sebion agrees with State's recommendation.  Defendant elected to not exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 1 year probation.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.   Write a letter of apology to the victim, to be approved by his agent.  Seek and maintain employment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  May apply for expungment at age 21 if he successfully completes probation. CC.  Restitution pay during probation, if any is requested.
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.   Plea/sentencing set for 6/1/15 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared with counsel SPD Carly Sebion.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defense waived reading of the complaint, and waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant on waiver of time limits and accepts his waiver.  Court orders a $1000 signature bond set with conditions and sets a pretrial for 4-8-15 at 10:00 and a status on 4-27-15 at 3:00.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Kathleen G. REPORT FOR BOOKING
